svcproc.title: TROUBLESHOOTING
svcproc.para: Following the procedures in the order presented will lead to the location and correction of charging system defects in the shortest possible time. Usually, only a portion of these procedures need be performed. It is seldom necessary to perform all the procedures to locate the problem.
To avoid damage to the electrical equipment, always observe the following precautions:

item.para: Do not short across or ground any of the terminals in the charging circuit except as specifically instructed in this section.
Never operate the alternator with the output terminal open circuited.
Make sure the alternator and battery have the same ground polarity.
When connecting a charger or a booster battery to the vehicle battery, connect negative to negative and positive to positive.

svcproc.para: Trouble in the charging system will show up as one of the following conditions:

item.para: An undercharged battery, as evidenced by slow specific gravity readings.
An overcharged battery, as evidenced by excessive water usage.

svcproc.para: To locate cause of trouble, proceed as outlined below:

note.para: The following checks must be performed before removing alternator from vehicle.

step1.para: Insure that an undercharged condition has not been caused by accessories having been left on for extended periods.
Check the drive belt for proper tension.
Test condition of battery. Recharge or replace battery as needed. Refer TO GROUP 08, BATTERY section in the Service Manual.
Inspect the wiring for defects. Check all connections for tightness and cleanliness, including the slip connectors at the alternator and engine cowl plus the cable clamps and battery posts.
With ignition switch on and all wiring harness leads connected, connect a voltmeter from:

step2.para: A zero reading indicates an open between voltmeter connection and battery. Repair if required.

step1.para: With all accessories turned off, connect a voltmeter across the battery. Operate engine at moderate speed. If voltage is 15.5 volts or more, remove alternator for repair.
If previous Steps 1 thru 6 check out satisfactory, check alternator as follows:

step2.para: Connect an ammeter in the circuit at the "BAT" terminal of the alternator.
Turn on accessories. Connect a carbon pile across the battery.
Operate engine at moderate speed as required, and adjust carbon pile as required to obtain maximum current output.
If ampere output is within 10 amperes of rated output as stamped on alternator frame, alternator most likely is not defective; re-check Steps 1 thru 6.
If ampere output is not within 10 amperes of rated output, determine if test hole ( Figure 4) is accessible. If accessible, go to Step H. If not accessible go to Step l.
Ground the field winding by inserting a screwdriver into the test hole ( Figure 4).

caution.para: Tab is within 3/4 inch of casting surface. Do not force screwdriver deeper than one inch into end frame as damage to the alternator could result.

step2.para: Operate engine at moderate speed as required, and adjust carbon pile as required to obtain maximum current output.
If output is within 10 amperes of rated output, as stamped on alternator frame, alternator is good.
If output is not within 10 amperes of rated output, check the field winding, diode trio, rectifier bridge, and stator as covered in REPAIR PROCEDURES.
If test hole is not accessible, disassemble alternator and make tests listed in REPAIR PROCEDURES.
